definition: to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society

sentences.english: The tops of the beggar's shoes had worn so thin that his toes were poking through.
sentences.chinese: 叫化子的鞋幫磨得很薄，腳趾頭快要出來了。

sentences.english: It is a supportive product to the upper and heel double-cooling forming machine.
sentences.chinese: 它是鞋幫後踵雙冷定型機的配套產品。

sentences.english: This is more flexible than the board last but less supportive.
sentences.chinese: 這種鞋幫柔韌性比第一種好，但是支撐性要差一些。

sentences.english: A deodorant healthcare layer is respectively clamped between the sole and the liner and between the upper and the lining layer.
sentences.chinese: 在鞋底與襯墊和鞋幫與襯層之間夾設有防臭保健層。

sentences.english: Its used to determine the peeling strength between the sole and the upper of a shoe .
sentences.chinese: 本機適用於檢驗成鞋鞋底和鞋幫之間的剝離強度。

sentences.english: The soles don’t have to be leather, but the uppers do.
sentences.chinese: 鞋底不必是皮質的，但是鞋幫得是。

sentences.english: The shoemaker carefully examined the leather before starting to cut out the uppers.
sentences.chinese: 鞋匠仔細察看了這張皮子以後纔開始裁剪鞋幫兒。

sentences.english: A lining layer is fixedly arranged on the inner side wall of the upper.
sentences.chinese: 在鞋幫內側壁上固定設置有襯層。
